page.title: 11Hedges and Boundaries.
page.content: Many of the traditional hedges still exist in Herefordshire.Most farms are mixed farms which require smaller fields and farmers tend to keep their hedges well-maintained. Several hedge counts were taken in the area.In one hedge five different species were found indicating that the hedge was at least 400 years old.Most of the hedges were 200 years old or more.Hedge laying is rare now,most farmers using mechanical machinery to cut and shape hedges. The most common species found in the hedges were:hawthorn, holly ,willow and horse chestnut.Others included oak, aspen, alder and yew. In the residential areas Leylandii has become the most popular hedge, mainly because it is fast growing and developes into a dense hedge quickly.
